channel.title: JFrame Opening Minimized?
channel.description:
http://pastebin.com/sPJyRnJ9
How come my JFrame is opening minimize? How do I get it to open to the size that is set?
thanks.

@Skyro wrote:

Thanks guys, didn’t even see me calling resize 2 times, nor the pack. brain derp.

Fix’t.

http://pastebin.com/q7uYaQZH

Read full topic

item.title: JFrame Opening Minimized?
item.dc:creator: @xEthanx xEthanx
item.description:
@xEthanx wrote:

Yeah several problems here. Cookies already pointed out that if you extend a class you don’t need to make an object for it. That’s the entire point of extending a class lol, if you create another object for it it’s just a waste of resources.

I’m not sure why you’re using pack(); with the code you’ve given. frame.pack(); [or pack(); if you’re extending JFrame] should really only be used if you’re rendering images into a window and you’d like it to re-size the window for you. Otherwise it will mess up your dimensions.

Read full topic

item.title: JFrame Opening Minimized?
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:2, topic:542694”]Also why on earth is RSApplet a subclass of JFrame but then in it’s constructor you create another JFrame “f”?
Also why on earth do you resize that JFrame twice?[/quote]

Going to ask the same questions…

also regarding what Fat Cookies said about pack()

The frame must not be re-sizable when you call [tt]pack()[/tt] (setResizable(boolean))

also giving each component a preferred size would make your setSize(Dimension) call obsolete as pack() determines the window size that fits all of the components without any extra white space, etc from human error

Read full topic

item.title: JFrame Opening Minimized?
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Don’t call pack() on the JFrame at the end.

Also why on earth is RSApplet a subclass of JFrame but then in it’s constructor you create another JFrame “f”?
Also why on earth do you resize that JFrame twice?

Read full topic
